column4: hey everybody, i am running edgy and just installed a new graphics card. now when I boot into Ubuntu I get a "BusyBox" prompt. Any ideas as to what I should do?
ctrl alt f2, login, run sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
press ctrl alt f2 @ the busybox promt?
ctrl atl f2 does nothing
did you see the grub screen?
yes
do ctrl alt f2 @ the grub screen?
did grub load?
and after that you get a busybox?
did you mess around with your grub settings?
do you still have your installation cd?
no. i just installed a new gfx card. thats all
have you tried booting in safe graphics mode?
recovery mode right?
yeah.
if you can get in recovery mode, you can reconfigure xorg.
looks like its gonna hang on "USB HID core driver"
thats weird.
yep booted to Busybox
all you did was change your graphics card?
that is all
